Author: Patchwork APT
Description: Researchers from ESET discover 12 malicious apps infected with the VajraSpy remote access tool by the India-linked Patchwork APT.

Author: Suspected 'nation state attacker'
Description: Cloudflare discloses that its internal Atlassian server was breached by a suspected 'nation state attacker' who accessed its Confluence wiki, Jira bug database, and Bitbucket source code management system using auth tokens stolen in the Okta attack.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: An international law enforcement operation code-named 'Synergia' has takes down over 1,300 command and control servers used in ransomware, phishing, and malware campaigns.

Author: IntelBroker
Description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is investigating a potential new breach after a threat actor put allegedly stolen data up for sale on a hacking forum, claiming it contains HPE credentials and other sensitive information.
Bank of America warns customers of a data breach exposing their personal information after Infosys McCamish Systems (IMS), one of its service providers, was hacked last year.

A joint forensic investigation by Access Now, the Citizen Lab at the Munk School of Global Affairs at the University of Toronto (the Citizen Lab), and local partners uncover that at least 35 individuals in Jordan have been targeted with Israeli firm NSO Group’s Pegasus spyware.

Author: Coldriver a.k.a. Iron Frontier, Calisto, Star Blizzard/Seaborgium
Target: Researchers and academics in the U.K.
Description: Threat actors working for Russia’s intelligence services are impersonating researchers and academics in an ongoing campaign to gain access to their colleagues’ email accounts.
Researchers at Akamai discover a variant of FritzFrog, a long-running botnet, now abusing the Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228 vulnerability.

Author: Homeland Justice
Description: Homeland Justice, an Iran-linked hacking group with a history of targeting Albanian state agencies and businesses says that it was behind an attack on the country’s Institute of Statistics (INSTAT), which is responsible for census information and other official statistics.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Municipality of Sant Antoni de Portmany
Description: The Municipality of Sant Antoni de Portmany in the Island of Ibiza, suffers a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Cado Security reveal that exposed Docker API endpoints over the internet are under assault from a sophisticated cryptojacking campaign called Commando Cat.

Date Occurred: During the second half of January 2024
Date Discovered: During the second half of January 2024
Description: Researchers at Check Point discover a surge in cyberattacks involving fake voicemails distributing malware.
Knight Barry Title files a notice of data breach after discovering that a recent cyberattack resulted in threat actors being able to access the company’s computer network.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for a DDOS attack against the UAE’s Flydubai Airline.
The Beaumont ISD phone system is back online following a ransomware attack.
AnyDesk confirms that it suffered a recent cyberattack that allowed threat actors to gain access to the company's production systems.

Author: Threat actors from China
Target: Multiple government agencies in the Philippines
Description: Government agencies in the Philippines announce they had repelled a cyberattack from threat actors suspected to be based in China.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Tennessee's Germantown announces a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Shuckworm a.k.a. Gamaredon and Primitive Bear
Description: Researchers from Securonix reveal the details of the STEADY#URSA campaign, an ongoing operation carried on by the russia-linked APT group Shuckworm (aka Gamaredon, and Primitive Bear, targeting the Ukrainian military with a new PowerShell backdoor called Subtle-Paws
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The North Carolina Housing Finance Agency (NCHFA) loses nearly $3 million in a business email compromise (BEC) scam.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Palo Alto discover a new spike of activity attributed to Mispadu Stealer.
Fairway Independent Mortgage Corporation (Fairway) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized user had accessed a third-party system utilized by Fairway.
Spectrum Vision Partners (SVP) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s computer network.
Sage Home Loans Corporation files a notice of data breach after discovering that it was the recent victim of a ransomware attack.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for ransomware attack to BrightStar Care. The same day another group Sieged Sec claims to have breached the same organization.
Groton Public Schools is the victim of a cyber attack.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat monitoring service Shadowserver reports multiple attackers leveraging the Ivanti CVE-2024-21893 vulnerability, with 170 distinct IP addresses attempting to exploit the flaw.
Pennsylvania’s court system is hit with a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack and experiences disruptions.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Undisclosed multinational company in Hong Kong
Description: Scammers steal HK$200 million (roughly $25,5 million) from a multi-national company using a deepfake conf call to trick an employee into transferring the funds.
Student rideshare startup HopSkipDrive confirms a data breach involving the personal data of more than 155,000 drivers.

Author: Threat actors from China
Description: A government source reveals that classified Japanese diplomatic documents were leaked after a Chinese cyberattacks on the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Northern Light Health is hit with a cyber attack.

Author: Vietnamese threat actor
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a campaign distributing a Python infostealer via a malicious Excel document.
State Street files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information in the company’s possession.

Author: 'ResumeLooters'
Target: Job Seekers in Australia, Taiwan, China, Thailand, India, and Vietnam
Description: Researchers from Group-IB reveal the details of a threat group named 'ResumeLooters' has stolen the personal data of over two million job seekers after compromising 65 legitimate job listing and retail sites using SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
Country: AU CN IN TH TW VN

Description: French healthcare services firm Viamedis suffers a cyberattack that exposed the data of policyholders and healthcare professionals in the country.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The municipality of Korneuburg in Austria says it was hit by a LockBit ransomware attack, leading to funerals reportedly being canceled and the town hall informing residents its staff can only be reached via telephone.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Local 1000, one of the largest unions in California, confirms that it is dealing with network disruptions due to a LockBit ransomware attack.
Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group discover a campaign targeting iPhone users in Indonesia via a spyware developed by the Spanish company Variston.

Medical Management Resource Group d/b/a/ American Vision Partners (American Vision Partners or MMRG) files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company experienced a cyberattack. 2.3 million Eyecare patients are affected.
Explicit comments about school children are sent to their parents in an apparent hack of Class Charts, a classroom app.
TIC Hosting, a hosting provider in Romania, suffers a data breach affecting 300 customers.
iTITAN Hosting, another hosting provider in Romania, suffers a data breach.

French healthcare services firm Almerys also suffers a cyberattack that exposed the data of policyholders and healthcare professionals in the country. The combination of the two breaches compromises the information of 33 million individuals.

Author: Volt Typhoon
Target: Critical infrastructure network in the United States
Description: A joint advisory from CISA, the NSA, the FBI, and partner Five Eyes agencies reveal that the Chinese Volt Typhoon cyber-espionage group infiltrated a critical infrastructure network in the United States and remained undetected for at least five years before being discovered.
Researchers from Trustwave discover a new password-stealing malware named Ov3r_Stealer, spreading through fake job advertisements on Facebook, aiming to steal account credentials and cryptocurrency.
LastPass warns that a fake copy of its app is being distributed on the Apple App Store, likely used as a phishing app to steal users' credentials.

Author: Roaming Mantis
Description: Researchers from McAfee discover a new version of the XLoader (a.k.a. MoqHao) Android malware that automatically executes on devices it infects, requiring no user interaction to launch.
Researchers from Check Point report an uptick in Raspberry Robin's malware operations starting October 2023, with large attack waves targeting systems worldwide.
The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2023-4762, a Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion bug, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Researchers from Crowdstrike discover a HijackLoader (a.k.a. IDAT Loader) variant that employs sophisticated evasion techniques.

Author: Kimsuky
Description: Researchers from S2W discover a Go language-based information-stealing malware distributed from a security program download page, dubbed Troll Stealer, attributed to the Kimsuky North Korean threat actor and targeting users in South Korea.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign distributing a RAT malware masquerading as illicit gambling-related content.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a malvertising campaign on Facebook distributing malware through a fatal accident scam and now spreading to Germany.

Author: Black Basta
Description: Car maker Hyundai Motor Europe suffers a Black Basta ransomware attack, with the threat actors claiming to have stolen three terabytes of corporate data.
Fortinet warns that CVE-2024-21762, a new critical remote code execution vulnerability in FortiOS SSL VPN is potentially being exploited in attacks.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat ?
Description: Researchers from Bitdefender discover a new Rust-based macOS malware, named Rustdoor, spreading as a Visual Studio update to provide backdoor access to compromised systems, using the infrastructure linked to the infamous ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang.

Researchers from Orange Cyberdefense reveal that threat actors are exploiting the CVE-2024-21893 server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA gateways to deploy the new DSLog backdoor on vulnerable devices.

Author: ? (Unknown threat actor)
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos disclose a stealthy cyberespionage campaign that targeted a non-profit organization in Saudi Arabia with a backdoor named Zardoor, and remained undetected for two years.

Target: 61 different online banking applications in Brazil
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a novel banking Trojan dubbed "Coyote," hunting for credentials for 61 different online banking applications in Brazil.
Researchers from Check Point warn of scammers using fake giveaways to steal credentials with 800 new ‘Temu’ domains registered in the past 3 months.

Target: Organizations in the academia and creative industries in Israel
Description: Anti-Zionist hacktivists publish the names, images, professions and social media accounts of hundreds of Jewish people working in academia and creative industries.

Author: Chinese threat actor
Description: The Military Intelligence and Security Service (MIVD) of the Netherlands revels that a Chinese cyber-espionage group breached the Dutch Ministry of Defence and deployed the COATHANGER malware on compromised devices exploiting the CVE-2022-42475 vulnerability targeting Fortinet devices.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) says Americans lost over $10 billion to scammers in 2023.
Security Researchers warn that exploitation of  CVE-2024-22024, a recently disclosed XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability impacting Ivanti enterprise VPN and network access products has commenced

Author: Black Basta
Description: Aircraft parts dealer Willis Lease Finance Corporation (WLFC) informs the US Securities and Exchange Commission that it fell victim to a cyberattack. The Black Basta ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
Threat actors are believed to have used a stolen private key to mint and steal over 1.79 billion PLA tokens, a cryptocurrency used within the PlayDapp ecosystem.

Author: .tprc
Description: Researchers from K7 detect a resurgence of the .tprc ransomware.
Signature Performance files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s IT network.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: Grace Lutheran Foundation, d/b/a Grace Lutheran Communities posts a notice about a data breach discovered on January 22, 2024. The same day the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
The Armentières Hospital Center is the victim of a ransomware attack.

Author: Backmydata
Description: 100 hospitals across Romania take their systems offline after a Backmydata ransomware attack hits their healthcare management system.
CISA warns that CVE-2023-43770, a Roundcube email server vulnerability patched in September is now actively exploited in cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
Researchers from Proofpoint reveal the details of a phishing campaign that has compromised hundreds of user accounts in dozens of Microsoft Azure environments, including those of senior executives.
Researchers from Resecurity identify a data leak of 6,453,254 Israeli voter records due to the breach of Elector, an Israeli software application used to manage political campaigns.

Author: R00Tk1T CYBER TEAM
Description: The group known as R00Tk1T CYBER TEAM releases a JSON dump with 90,000 voters from the past Parliamentary Elections in Lebanon.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: SiegedSec and ByteMeCrew
Description: SiegedSec and ByteMeCrew exploit a vulnerability and access the data collected from the TheTruthSpy stalkwerware.

Author: Cyber Security companies from China
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One reveal the details of a media campaign, orchestrated by China, alleging US hacking operations, following condemnation from the US, UK and EU in July 2021 over Chinese cyber activities.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Palo Alto discover a new campaign carried out via the Glupteba modular malware.

Author: Russia
Description: The French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs accuses Russia of running a disinformation campaign through a network of 193 websites, aimed at disseminating Russian disinformation, targeting Kyiv's Western allies ahead of the second anniversary of Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Multiple threat actors including TA577, Ducktail, BianLian and Black Basta
Target: Financial institutions in Europe and the USA
Description: Researchers from EclecticIQ observe cybercriminals increasing the delivery of the DarkGate loader following the FBI's takedown of Qakbot infrastructure.
Researchers from Zscaler discover a new campaign delivering the Pikabot malware downloader.
Researchers from Resecurity identify an individual who claimed to be selling a 21.58 database containing information about 24.3 million Iraqi citizens.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: SinglePoint Outsourcing (SinglePoint) files a notice of data breach discovering that an unauthorized party had accessed its computer network.
Coleman Professional Services (Coleman Health Services, Coleman) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed several employee email accounts.

Target: Office of the Colorado State Public Defender
Description: A ransomware attack on the Office of the Colorado State Public Defender forces the agency to shut down its computer network.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: MSH International Canada, the insurance provider for members of the Public Service Health Care Plan who are posted abroad or travelling, says it recently detected a “cybersecurity incident”.
The Danbury School District confirms to have been hit with a ransomware attack.
The city of Coeur d'Alene announces it had detected malware in its computer network.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that the Bumblebee malware has returned after a four-month vacation, targeting thousands of organizations in the United States in phishing campaigns.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: Prudential Financial discloses that its network was breached, with the attackers stealing employee and contractor data before being blocked from compromised systems. Few days later the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: IntelBroker
Description: The IntelBroker threat actor leals 200,000 records on a hacker forum, claiming they contain the mobile phone numbers, email addresses, and other personal information of Facebook Marketplace users.

Author: Water Hydra a.k.a. DarkCasino
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the APT group Water Hydra has been exploiting the Microsoft Defender SmartScreen vulnerability (CVE-2024-21412) in its campaigns targeting financial market traders.
Battery maker VARTA AG announces that it was targeted by a cyberattack that forced it to shut down IT systems, causing production to stop at its plants.
Researchers from Sophos discover fresh Qbot activity, with up to 10 new malware builds emerging since mid-December.
Poland’s new prime minister Donald Tusk says that he has uncovered documents which “confirm 100%” that the prior administration illegally deployed Pegasus spyware, according to local news reports.

Author: Charming Kitten, a.k.a. APT35, CharmingCypress, Mint Sandstorm, TA453, and Yellow Garuda
Description: Researchers from Volexity link the Iranian-origin threat actor known as Charming Kitten to a new set of attacks aimed at Middle East policy experts with a new backdoor called BASICSTAR by creating a fake webinar portal.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign leveraging tools like "smtp-validator" and "Email to SMS" to deploy Revenge RAT.

Author: ThreeAM
Description: Garon Products is hit with a ThreeAM ransomware attack.

The Government Accountability Office warns of a breach resulting in the compromise of data associated with thousands of current and former employees. The attack was carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-22515 Atlassian vulnerability from one of its contractors, CGI Federal.
Jeff Wyler Automotive Family (Jeff Wyler) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access its computer network.
Bradford-Scott Data (Bradford-Scott) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed, and may have copied,  files from the company’s computer network.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: Trans-Northern Pipelines (TNPI) confirms its internal network was breached in November 2023 and that it's now investigating claims of data theft made by the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang.
Microsoft warns that CVE-2024-21410, a critical vulnerability in Exchange Server was exploited as a zero-day before being fixed during this month's Patch Tuesday.

Author: FBI
Target: APT28, a.k.a. Fancy Bear and Sednit
Description: The FBI takes down a botnet of small office/home office (SOHO) Ubiquiti routers used by Russia's Main Intelligence Directorate of the General Staff (GRU) to proxy malicious traffic and to target the United States and its allies in spearphishing and credential theft attacks.

Author: RansomHouse
Description: Researchers from Trellix reveal that the RansomHouse ransomware operation has created a new tool named 'MrAgent' that automates the deployment of its data encrypter across multiple VMware ESXi hypervisors.

Author: North Korean threat actors
Target: Staff member of the South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol
Description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office discloses that presumed North Korean threat actors breached the personal emails of one of his staff members ahead of Yoon’s trip to Europe in November.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: 'Recently'
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a phishing campaign leveraging the AnyDesk remote desktop application to target employees.

Author: Gyeongheung
Description: The South Korea's National Intelligence Service (NIS) warns that a North Korean IT organization known as "Gyeongheung", affiliated with the secretive Office 39, is selling gambling websites pre-infected with malware to South Korean cyber crime organizations.

Author: JKwerlo
Target: Multiple organizations in France and Spain
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a new Go-based ransomware dubbed JKwerlo targeting victims in France and Spain.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a series of malware droppers dubbed the “TicTacToe dropper,” utilized to deliver various malicious payloads to victims.
The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2024-21351, a Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security feature bypass vulnerability, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Davlyn Investments Property Management files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access its IT network.
Lexington Medical Center files a notice of data breach discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access an employee’s email account.
Superior Communications files a notice of data breach after discovering that certain files on the company’s computer network were removed by an unauthorized party.
Tax Favored Benefits (TFB) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had gained access to an employee’s email account.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for targeting ChatGPT and its parent company, OpenAI, with a series of DDoS attacks.

Author: GoldFactory
Target: Individuals in the Asia-Pacific region, mainly Thailand and Vietnam
Description: Researchers from Group-IB discover a new iOS and Android trojan named 'GoldPickaxe', which employs a social engineering scheme to trick victims into scanning their faces and ID documents, which are believed to be used to generate deepfakes for unauthorized banking access.

Author: Turla
Target: Organizations in various sectors (e.g. government, military, education, research, pharmaceutical, NGO) O
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos and CERT.NGO discover a new malware dubbed TinyTurla-NG and TurlaPower-NG used by the Russian hacker group Turla to maintain access to a target’s network and to steal sensitive data.

Target: Individuals in Canada and the U.S.
Description: Ukraine's cyber police arrests a 31-year-old for running a cybercrime operation that gained access to bank accounts of American and Canadian users and sold them on the dark web.
PSI Software SE, a German software developer for complex production and logistics processes suffers a ransomware attack that impacts its internal infrastructure.

Author: U.S.A.
Description: The U.S. conduct a cyberattack against MV Behshad, an Iranian military ship that had been collecting intelligence on cargo vessels in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the Multi-State Information Sharing & Analysis Center (MS-ISAC) reveal that a threat actor gained access to a US government organization’s network using the compromised credentials for a former employee’s administrative account.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The EU Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-EU) reveals that organizations based in the EU are being targeted by spear phishing campaigns leveraging EU political and diplomatic events.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Android users with mobile crypto wallet or banking applications
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a malicious sample posing as a legitimate crypto wallet including the SpyNote RAT with several interesting additions related to anti-analysis and cryptocurrencies.

Author: Threat actors from Pakistan
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a massive utility scam campaign spreading via online ads.

Author: Cy4Gate
Description: Meta removes a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to an Italian surveillance-for-hire company Cy4Gate used to collect intelligence about their victims.

Author: RCS Labs
Description: Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to an Italian spyware firm called RCS Labs owned by Cy4Gate.

Author: IPS Intelligence
Target: Multiple organizations in  Italy, Tunisia, the US, Malta, Oman, Turkey, France, Zambia, Germany, and Mexico
Description: Meta removes a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to an Italian surveillance-for-hire firm, IPS Intelligence,
Country: FR DE IT MT MX OM TN TR US ZM

Author: Variston IT and TrueL IT
Description: Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to a Spanish spyware firm called Variston IT, its Italian subsidiary and exploit developer TrueL IT, and a UAE-based firm called Protect Electronic Systems.

Author: Protect Electronic Systems
Description: Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to a UAE-based firm called Protect Electronic Systems.

Author: Negg Group
Description: Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to Italian spyware irm Negg Group.

Author: Mollitiam Industries
Description: Meta removes a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to a Spanish firm, Mollitiam Industries, that advertises a data collection service and spyware targeting Windows, MacOS and Android.

Author: Threat actors from China
Description: Meta removes 33 Facebook accounts, six Pages, six Groups, and four Instagram accounts originating from China for violating the policy against coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Threat actors from Myanmar
Description: Meta removes 381 Facebook accounts, 88 Pages and 19 Groups originating from Myanmar, for violating the policy against coordinated inauthentic behavior, targeting domestic audiences in that country.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Threat actors from Ukraine
Description: Meta removes 1,020 Facebook accounts, five Pages, two Groups and 711 Instagram accounts originating from Ukraine, for violating the policy against coordinated inauthentic behavior, targeting domestic audiences in Ukraine and Kazakhstan.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Sentinel One discover a campaign where threat actors employed AWS Simple Notification Service (SNS) and the SNS Sender script to send SMS messages impersonating the US Postal Service.
Virginia Farm Bureau (VFB) files a notice of data breach after the company’s IT system was targeted in a ransomware attack.
A West Orange town council meeting is “Zoom bombed” by outsiders making racist and antisemitic statements.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
